intro: Chirita walkerae subsp. parviflora, commonly known as the small-flowered chirita, is a member of the Gesneriaceae family. It is a herbaceous perennial plant native to tropical regions of Africa. The plant features opposite, ovate leaves with a smooth texture and a dark green color. Its flowers are small, typically white or pale pink, with a tubular shape and five lobes. It thrives in shaded, moist environments and is often cultivated as a decorative houseplant.
